title: Amid Suspicion Over SafeSport, the Body That Investigates Abuse in Sports Wants to Grow
sub_head: The chief executive of the U.S. Center for SafeSport sees taking on more cases as a solution for the embattled system
body:
Gymnastics champion Aly Raisman was blunt last month when she told U.S. senators what she thought of “SafeSport,” the U.S. Olympic movement’s system for responding to abuse allegations like the ones she and others fought to make against Larry Nassar.
“I’m trying to be respectful here: I don’t like SafeSport,” Raisman said. “I hear from many survivors that they report their abuse and it’s like playing hot potato, where somebody else kicks it over to somebody else and they don’t hear back for a really long time.”
